title: How to Ride on the Back of a Motorcycle

steps.title: Make sure your driver is experienced at riding with a passenger, aka "two-up" or pillion.
steps.content: Make sure your driver is experienced at riding with a passenger, aka "two-up" or pillion. Driving with a passenger is very different from driving alone. This is not the time for you to teach each other new skills. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Wear proper clothing.
steps.content: Wear proper clothing. Even if it's hot, you want a leather jacket or purpose designed motorcycle jacket and (at least) blue jeans. Wear high-top leather boots if you have them. This is your only protection against road rash and (more likely) exhaust-pipe burns. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Wear a proper helmet.
steps.content: Wear a proper helmet. Laws or no laws, how much is your head worth? [3] X Research source

steps.title: Wear some sort of eye/face protection.
steps.content: Wear some sort of eye/face protection. At driving speed, hitting a large bug can feel like getting hit with a golf ball. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Wear gloves.
steps.content: Wear gloves. Leather gloves are a good option. Sports gloves Wil offer your hands more protection in an accident than gloves designed just to get your hands warm.

steps.title: If the bike has adjustable suspension, the manual should tell you how to set it for a second person and the driver's and passenger's combined weight.
steps.content: If the bike has adjustable suspension, the manual should tell you how to set it for a second person and the driver's and passenger's combined weight.

steps.title: Lower the passenger foot-pegs.
steps.content: Lower the passenger foot-pegs.

steps.title: Be aware your driver needs to get on the bike first.
steps.content: Be aware your driver needs to get on the bike first. Almost all passenger seats are too high for the passenger's feet to reach the ground easily.

steps.title: Have your driver raise the kickstand and stand the bike up fully upright.
steps.content: Have your driver raise the kickstand and stand the bike up fully upright.

steps.title: Wait until the driver is ready, approach the bike from the side.
steps.content: Wait until the driver is ready, approach the bike from the side. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Place your foot (left if approaching from the left, right otherwise) on the foot-peg and swing your body over the seat like you're getting on a horse.
steps.content: Place your foot (left if approaching from the left, right otherwise) on the foot-peg and swing your body over the seat like you're getting on a horse. Put your hands on the driver's shoulders for balance if needed. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Place your other foot on the other foot-peg and sit straight up.
steps.content: Place your other foot on the other foot-peg and sit straight up.

steps.title: Place your hands around the driver's midsection, or on their hips.
steps.content: Place your hands around the driver's midsection, or on their hips. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Tell your driver you're ready to go.
steps.content: Tell your driver you're ready to go.

steps.title: Be safe.
steps.content: Be safe. When riding, do not make any hand signals to other road users and ensure that you lean WITH the rider. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Keep your feet on the foot-pegs when the bike stops at lights, in traffic etc.
steps.content: Keep your feet on the foot-pegs when the bike stops at lights, in traffic etc. DON'T take them off until you dismount Even if you can reach the ground it doesn't help the driver.

steps.title: Don't keep your head too close to the driver's, or you'll bump heads when the bike slows down.
steps.content: Don't keep your head too close to the driver's, or you'll bump heads when the bike slows down. Just as motorcycles accelerate faster than cars, they decelerate faster, too.

steps.title: Be aware at normal driving speeds, the driver will not be able to hear you unless you shout VERY LOUD.
steps.content: Be aware at normal driving speeds, the driver will not be able to hear you unless you shout VERY LOUD. You might want to agree upon a certain shoulder tap or something if you need to get his or her attention.

steps.title: DO let the driver concentrate.
steps.content: DO let the driver concentrate. DON'T backseat drive.

steps.title: Enjoy the ride!
steps.content: Enjoy the ride!
